page.title: 19THE PARISH COUNCIL BURWELL.
page.content: { Parish Council Elections}are held every four years.A by-election was also needed this year.There were four candidates for it. When the polling station closes at 9.00pm they start by counting the votes.Then the Deputy Returning Officer anounces the result. The Parish Council only puts notices around the Parish. This could be why the turn-out is low.Another reason could be that they don't issue poll cards. The successful candidate's job is to go to{Parish Council meetings}at the {Jubilee Reading Room}and discuss matters that affect the Parish.People can also go to him if they have a problem which he can then bring up at meetings.
